Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: svtplay-dl
Description: Download videos from your favourite play services

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for svtplay-dl

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Show program's version number and exit

Arguments.Name: -o
Arguments.Description: Outputs to the given filename or folder

Arguments.Name: --subfolder
Arguments.Description: Create a subfolder titled as the show, non-series gets in folder movies

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Specify configuration file

Arguments.Name: configfile
Arguments.Description: configfile

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Overwrite if file exists already

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Resume a download (RTMP obsolete)

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Enable for live streams (RTMP based ones)

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Define capture time in minutes of a live stream

Arguments.Name: capture_time
Arguments.Description: capture_time

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Be less verbose

Arguments.Name: --silent-semi
Arguments.Description: Only show a message when the file is downloaded

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: Username (if applicable)

Arguments.Name: username
Arguments.Description: username

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Password (if applicable)

Arguments.Name: password
Arguments.Description: password

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Download thumbnail from the site if available

Arguments.Name: -g
Arguments.Description: Do not download any video, but instead print the URL

Arguments.Name: --get-only-episode-url
Arguments.Description: Do not get video URLs, only print the episode URL

Arguments.Name: --dont-verify-ssl-cert
Arguments.Description: Don't attempt to verify SSL certificates

Arguments.Name: --http-header
Arguments.Description: A header to add to each HTTP request

Arguments.Name: header1=value;header2=value2
Arguments.Description: header1=value;header2=value2

Arguments.Name: --cookies
Arguments.Description: A cookies to add to each HTTP request

Arguments.Name: cookie1=value;cookie2=value2
Arguments.Description: cookie1=value;cookie2=value2

Arguments.Name: --exclude
Arguments.Description: Exclude videos with the WORD(s) in the filename. Comma separated

Arguments.Name: WORD1,WORD2,...
Arguments.Description: WORD1,WORD2,...

Arguments.Name: --after-date
Arguments.Description: Only videos published on or after this date

Arguments.Name: yyyy-MM-dd
Arguments.Description: yyyy-MM-dd

Arguments.Name: --proxy
Arguments.Description: Use the specified HTTP/HTTPS/SOCKS proxy. To enable experimental SOCKS proxy, specify a proper scheme. For example socks5://127.0.0.1:1080/

Arguments.Name: proxy
Arguments.Description: proxy

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Explain what is going on

Arguments.Name: --nfo
Arguments.Description: Create a NFO file

Arguments.Name: --force-nfo
Arguments.Description: Download only NFO if used with --nfo

Arguments.Name: --only-audio
Arguments.Description: Only download audio if audio and video is separated

Arguments.Name: --only-video
Arguments.Description: Only download video if audio and video is separated

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Choose what format to download based on bitrate/video resolution. It will download the best format by default

Arguments.Name: quality
Arguments.Description: quality

Arguments.Name: -Q
Arguments.Description: Allow given quality (as above) to differ by an amount

Arguments.Name: amount
Arguments.Description: amount

Arguments.Name: -P
Arguments.Description: Preferred download method (dash, hls, or http)

Arguments.Name: preferred
Arguments.Description: preferred

Arguments.Name: --list-quality
Arguments.Description: List the quality for a video

Arguments.Name: --stream-priority
Arguments.Description: If two streams have the same quality, choose the one you prefer

Arguments.Name: dash,hls,http
Arguments.Description: dash,hls,http

Arguments.Name: --format-preferred
Arguments.Description: Choose the format you prefer, use --list-quality to show which one to choose from

Arguments.Name: --audio-language
Arguments.Description: Choose the language of the audio (it can override the default one), use --list-quality to show which one to choose from

Arguments.Name: AUDIO_LANGUAGE
Arguments.Description: AUDIO_LANGUAGE

Arguments.Name: --audio-role
Arguments.Description: Choose the role of the audio (it can override the default one), use --list-quality to show which one to choose from

Arguments.Name: AUDIO_ROLE
Arguments.Description: AUDIO_ROLE

Arguments.Name: -S
Arguments.Description: Download subtitle from the site if available

Arguments.Name: -M
Arguments.Description: Merge subtitle with video/audio file with corresponding ISO639-3 language code. This invokes --remux automatically

Arguments.Name: --force-subtitle
Arguments.Description: Download only subtitle if its used with -S

Arguments.Name: --require-subtitle
Arguments.Description: Download only if a subtitle is available

Arguments.Name: --all-subtitles
Arguments.Description: Download all available subtitles for the video

Arguments.Name: --raw-subtitles
Arguments.Description: Also download the subtitles in their native format

Arguments.Name: --convert-subtitle-colors
Arguments.Description: Converts the color information in subtitles, to <font color=""> tags

Arguments.Name: -A
Arguments.Description: Try to download all episodes

Arguments.Name: --all-last
Arguments.Description: Get last NN episodes instead of all episodes

Arguments.Name: NN
Arguments.Description: NN

Arguments.Name: --include-clips
Arguments.Description: Include clips from websites when using -A

Arguments.Name: --cmore-operatorlist
Arguments.Description: Show operatorlist for cmore

Arguments.Name: operator
Arguments.Description: operator

Arguments.Name: --no-remux
Arguments.Description: Do not automatically remux to mp4

Arguments.Name: --no-merge
Arguments.Description: Do not automatically merge video, audio and possibly also subtitle(s) together

Arguments.Name: --no-postprocess
Arguments.Description: Do not postprocess anything

Arguments.Name: --keep-original
Arguments.Description: Do postprocessing while also keeping original files

Arguments.Name: --output-format
Arguments.Description: Format you want resulting file in (mkv or mp4), mp4 is default

Arguments.Name: mp4,mkv
Arguments.Description: mp4,mkv

Arguments.Name: urls
Arguments.Description: urls
